uuid: Wu et al. (2020) The EMBO Journal
hypothesis:
I aim to understand the heterogeneity of stromal cells in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) and their role in immune evasion. The tumor microenvironment (TME) is highly complex, and cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and perivascular-like (PVL) cells play critical roles in cancer progression. By using single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq), I can classify distinct stromal subpopulations and their interactions with immune cells, which may contribute to immune suppression and therapeutic resistance.
Samples: Five primary TNBC tumors.
Cells: 24,271 single cells sequenced with an average of 4,854 cells per patient.
Methods: 10x Genomics scRNA-seq, flow cytometry, and computational analysis of cell-cell interactions.
result: The dataset information are provided in the hypothesis.
